question.text: At <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>35</mn><msup><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>,</mo></math> the vapour pressure of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>,</mo></math> is <math><mn>512</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> Hg and that of acetone is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>144</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>.</mo></math> A solution of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> in acetone has a total vapour pressure of <math><mn>600 </mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> . The false statement amongst the following is:

options.text: Raoult's law is not obeyed by this system

a mixture of <math><mn>100</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><mn>100</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></math> acetone has a volume <math><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mn>200</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></math>
<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> and acetone are less attracted to each other than to themselves
heat must be absorbed in order to produce the solution at <math><msup><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

solution.text:
P observed =600
 
P Cal = P A 0 x A +P B 0 x B

=512x+344−344x

=168x+344

=512 (If x=1 for maximum value)

Thus,   P cal < P observed

Thus' the process is deviated from Raoult's law, showing positive deviation from Raoult's law.

ΔH>0 , i.e., is absorbed
